ns0:StringWithMarkup.ns0:String: AQUATIC TOXICITY: TLM: GAMMER LACUSTRIS 690 UG/L/48 HR
AQUATIC TOXICITY: TLM: BLUEGILL 14 UG/L/48 HR

EC50 Daphnia magna 0.35 ug/l/48 hr at 2 °C, first instar (95% confidence limit 0.25-0.49 ug/L). Static bioassay without aeration, pH 7.2-7.5, water hardness 40-50 mg/l as calcium carbonate and alkalinity of 30-35 mg/l. /Technical material, 100%/

LC50 Gammarus fasciatus 8.6 ug/l/96 hr at 15 °C, mature (95% confidence limit 5.4-13.8 ug/l). Static bioassay without aeration, pH 7.2-7.5, water hardness 40-50 mg/l as calcium carbonate and alkalinity of 30-35 mg/l. /Technical material, 100%/

LC50 Salmo clarki (cutthroat trout) 110 ug/l/96 hr at 13 °C, wt 1.0 g (95% confidence limit 98-120 ug/l). Static bioassay without aeration, pH 7.2-7.5, water hardness 40-50 mg/l as calcium carbonate and alkalinity of 30-35 mg/l. /Technical material, 100%, tested in hard water, 272 ppm CaCO3/

LC50 Salmo gairdneri (rainbow trout) 69 ug/kg/96 hr at 13 °C, wt 1.4 g (95% confidence limit 59-81 ug/L). Static bioassay without aeration, pH 7.2-7.5, water hardness 40-50 mg/l as calcium carbonate and alkalinity of 30-35 mg/l. /Technical material, 100%, tested in hard water, 272 ppm CaCO3/

LC50 Micropterus salmoides (largemouth bass) 22 ug/kg/96 hr at 18 °C, wt 1.3 g (95% confidence limit 20-25 ug/l). Static bioassay without aeration, pH 7.2-7.5, water hardness 40-50 mg/l as calcium carbonate and alkalinity of 30-35 mg/l. /Technical material, 100%, tested in hard water, 272 ppm CaCO3/
LC50 Japanese quail oral 6640 ppm in 5-day diet (95% confidence limit 5105-9000 ppm)
LC50 Pheasant oral 4067 ppm in 5-day diet (95% confidence limit 3593-4610 ppm)
LC50 Mallard oral approx 3600 ppm in 5-day diet
LD50 Anas platyhynchos (mallard) oral 277 mg/kg, 3-4 months old males (95% confidence limit 172-443 mg/kg) /72% (cis-47%, trans-25%)/
LD50 Phasianus colchicus (pheasant) oral 240 mg/kg, 3-7 months old males (95% confidence limit 190-302 mg/kg) /72% (cis-47%, trans-25%)/
